message: Is it possible to estimate how much memory nginx will use for a django app?  (say caching is outsourced to memcached or redis)
cool thanks. moral of the story OMG dont use fastcgi, except that it works fine for some people

If it's just nginx itself reverse proxying to gunicorn, I would be surprised if nginx used over 6mb of RAM. The gunicorn instances are another story, though; that'll be entirely dependent on your application, queries, how much you materialize into memory at any given time, etc.
I will be checking out gunicorn for sure tho.
do you like gunicorn over fastcgi? anyone know of any performance stats?
@alex oh, I didn't realize eventlet.wsgi was doing it all, i thought it was just /media/ calls
/live/ calls *only* hit the evenlet endpoint, everything else uses evenlet.wsgi to serve django
for values of people that are @ericflo
And /media/ is the part that doesn't hit eventlet, thats pure nginx
